text: Bottle. Aroma is earty, lactic, citric. Taste pretty sour, dry, light tart. Flavor light mineral, soil, funky, leather and lemon.

Bottle shared by tom10101, MANY MANY THANKS MAN FOR THE OPPORTUNITY! Tasted blind. Pours a pretty clear golden with a small white head that leaves low lacing. Nose is of light rubber, sweaty socks and generally funky. Taste is moderately tart and a little citric. Body is medium, carbonation moderate. A really nice one! Felt almost like some 3 Fonteinen at times but I also thought it could be an Oud Beersel maybe.
750ml bottle at de heeren. Pours out a golden topped with a tall white head. Nose is great sour funk barnyard wow amazing. Taste is more of the nice funky tartness.

Bottle: Served in a taster:
Fluffy off white head. Cloudy orange body.
Nose is immense cellar tone with some dust and mold... quite woody and a very light fruity tint.
Flavour is more bitter than tart, some yellow/orange fruit, wood, funk, light dry, cellar, light farm and some light light cheese...
Aftertaste is dry, wood, fruit, funk, cellar, wet stone...
Low carbo, soft light creamy mouthfeel, more than just medium bodied.
With the last pour it becomes a bit more tart than bitter...
The nose scares a bit but the flavour is good! Very nice beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle with everybody for Maxs doctorate. Pours a hazed amber with a medium sized white head. Musk, lightly sweet and softly fruity, apricot, soft sweetness. Slow and musky, gentle wood. Lovely

sample from bottle, poured a deeper orange hazy colour with a soft white head. nose of barnyard funk, citrus, light oak, tart apples, earth notes, brett spice, grains, and light grapefruit. dry aftertaste. not very impressed
Bottle at Himmeriget. Pours clear orange with a modest white head which longers. Aroma is pepper, cheeee and basement musk. Taste is pepper, citrus lemon, citrus zest, fluffy cream.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - orange coloured pour with nice dissipating white head. Aroma and taste is citric fruity with notes of grape, some nice musky funky notes, straw, hay, very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Proefglas van 75cl-fles op Lambic & Sour Ale Sunday 2016 te Vichte. U: Helder goudblond met witte schuimkraag. G: Groene appeltjes, zurig en iets "funky". S: Sterk zurige smaak. Fruitig, opnieuw groene appels. Verfrissend! M: Zeer stevige carbonatie.

750 ml bottle at Gueuze tasting 2016, Ulfborg. Unclear golden orange color with off white head. Yeasty aroma, funky, dusty, barnyard, wood, citrusy fruity. Sweet and acidic sour taste. Medium oily body with lively carbonation.

From Bottle @fonefan gueuze tasting Ulfborg, thanks to Nightfall - june 24th 2016. Pours an unclear orangy amber with a small white head. Aroma has blue cheese, oak, lots of mold, super leathery dry, light grapes. Taste is sour, dry, funky, brettish, rather short lasting taste, but really tasty for as long as it lasts.
Bottle @ Ulfborg gueze tasting. Light cloudy dark golden pour with a huge frothy head that quickly vanishes. Very high carbo, stone fruit, red apples, citric, lemon and some hay.

Bottle @ Gueuze tasting 2016 ulfborg. Pours golden with a white head, seems a bit overcarbonated. Aroma of funk, loads of horseblanket, like notes, light sesam notes. Rather fruity, stonefruits. Taste is rather funky, good barn. :)
Bottle @ Ulfborg Gueuze Tasting thanks to Nightfall. Thanks! Pours hazy darkish orange with a big white head. Aromas of bright citrus, grapes, deep funk, green apples,

August 14, 2015. Bottle.Tasting at omhper. 
Cloudy orange with a very large creamy white head. Aroma is funky, fruity with peach, apricots, green apples, skins, lemon, 
Taste is tart, fruity, funky. Finish is fruity sour with lemon, apple skins, funky barnyard notes, some leather and minerals with a dry tart finish. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.
Stark karbonisierter Antrunk mit angenehmer Säuerlichkeit. Kurzer Mittelteil, trocken bitter, Käsenoten. Holzig, kurzer Nachhall. Ok. 11/11/9/9/9
Bottle at the restaurant. Nice. Easy going, citrus, nice sourness. Funky and dusty. Quite full on. Wish I had made more notes.

(750ml bottle from DHVL, purchased/drank Nov 16 2015) Pours hazy orange gold with a huge white head and lace after a violent gushing upon opening. No shortage of carb, and it probably was a bit disturbed by me carrying it back to Brussels. Aroma of green apple, apple skin, damp basement, a little citrus peel, dried herbs, pretty woody (Girardin there?) with some tannins on the nose, maybe light phenols. Flavour is smooth but not particularly punchy. Lemon, lime and a little orange juice, acidity is light and lactic. A bit of apple skin, citrus pith, light dry grass. Finish has woody tannins, a bit of dry grassy medicinal hops, soft lingering fruit. Medium mouthfeel with light carb remaining. Nice balanced gueuze albeit a little restrained and anonymous. Maybe my fault for drinking it a few hours after Helena and Zomer, because its a good blend in its own right.

(750ml bottle thanks to brystmar) lightly cloudy, thick yellowish bubbles. Nose of flint, wood char, must, bone dry, salt and mushroom. Taste is flinty, wood char, wet barrel, lemon, bone dry. Good beer but lacking in complexity a bit.

Bottled.  Cloudy amber, rich coarse head. Concentrated funky lemon peel and hay aroma. Tart with light-medium body and rounded, spritzy mouthfeel. Hay, cobwebs and barnyard. Mild citric acid and stale hop bitterness. Rich and complex.

2/21/15. Sampled during RBWG 2015. Golden pour with a small off-white head, good lacing. Nice aroma, good blend of barnyard funk, tartness, vanilla, oak, hay, and citrus. Good flavor, nice sourness, balanced, not overly puckering, vanilla, oak, hay, citrus. Tasty!

Bottle at de Heeren. Yellow pour with a white head. Mild lemon zest and barnyard bouquet. Tasty with mild citrus and lemon zest highlights. Dry with hints of brine and and funk. Good body and mouthfeel.
Tasted at RBWG. Cloudy orange. Light citrus, hay, barnyard, grassy. Good carbonation. Light and crisp.

Bottle at Coppertail Brewing during the RBWG 2015 Grand Tasting. Hazy orange with off-white head. Aromas of floral, barnyard funk. Tastes of floral, barnyard funk, hay, light citrus. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Tasted during RBWG15 Grand Tasting. Hazy golden, slight orange color. No head. Big oaky funky gueuze character. Medium-plus body. Smooth, kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. Light slick. Satisfying moderate sour taste. Light sweet. Good dryness. Great stuff. Much better than expected, for a bootleg blend.
Bottle - Plum, white grape and some feet. Cloudy gold with a nice white head. Big acidic tart notes with grape and some petroleum jelly. Nice with a clean finish.
Poured a cloudy gold color with aromas of wet wood, oak, funk and light white wine. Flavors match the aromas a nice funkiest not over the top very enjoyable.
Pours a hazy gold with a thin white head. Aroma of funk, oak, white wine, wheat. Taste is sour wheat, oak, funk, white wine and oak. Solid.
Golden pour, billowy white head. Nose is musty, basement, funk. Taste is funky, tart lemon, grass, very bright. Light mouthfeel.

Acquired at DHVL in April. 2011 Bottling enjoyed in a Gueuze glass at 45 Degrees F.

A - Pours a dark gold with a 2 finger solid white creamy head. 

S - Nose is very funky. lots of mold and old mushrooms. Lots of shoe and just a minimal amount of lemon, grass and straws. 

T - Taste is okay. Its a very thin bodied beer. Lots of sour at the finish, tip of tongue lemon sourness. Cheese curds, a lot of wood and grapes with sour kiwi and grapefruit. 

M - Tons of carbonation but then that fades and its very thin, almost oily / slick bodied.

O - This beer may shine in 10 years but as it stands, Im not a huge fan.
Bottle - Pours light amber. Aroma is lemon zest, sour, and grass. Lots of carbonation, maybe a little too much. Taste is lemons, grassy, champagne feel, some funk.

750ml bottle pours hazy pale orange with medium head. Nose is swirling musty farm funk and old attic wood, juicy bretty fruit notes, funky stonefruit, dusty oak, toasted grain, wonderful complex nose I could sniff for days. Taste is classic gueuze profile with very well balanced tart peach, tangerine, green apple, musty barrel, toast, crawlspace, some soggy grain. Finish is dry light pale grainy brett fruit, tart green apple skin, wood, funk. Fantastic.

Pours a medium golden color with a finger of fizzy white foam. Nose is funky basement musk and composting fungus. Palate follows with nice layers of musty basement funk, hints of stonefruit, dusty oak, horsehair and a lingering cobwebs.

Bottle: Poured a hazy beige color ale with a nice thick foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma consists of tart green apple with some light barnyard and funky notes also perceptible. Taste is also a well-balanced mix of sour and tart green apple notes with some barnyard and hay notes with almost no acidity in the finish. Body is about average for style with good carbonation. I love the complexity and the limited amount of acidity in this beer.

Bottle from Phil at 12K tasting. Amber with a creamy head. CO2 / epson salt, grass, granny smith apples, horse blanket and hay. High carbonation and moderate body, fresh and lively, dry, tart and quite tasty.

Pours light orange slighly cloudy limited head and no lacing. Nose is sour apples, dough. Flavours are fruity, sour apples. Taste is medium sour, light fruit sweetness. Mouth is sticky, with a nice dry finish. Great beer.

A hazed blonde Gueuze with a thin white head. In aroma, loads of Brett, ground cherries, lactic acid, Epsom salts, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet lactic acid, Epsom salts, Brett, classic, very nice. Merci Boutip.

750 ml bottle shared by drabmuh, thanks Matt! Pours a translucent golden orange color with lasting foamy head that leaves moderate white lacing. Aroma is minerals, Brett, funk, barnyard and the usual gueuze notes. Thin to medium bodied, active carbonation, and a pleasant rusty, oxidized finish.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 Fully traditional gueuze (oude geuze) made especially for the 20th anniversary of Belgiums best-known beer restaurant, De Heeren Van Liedekercke, with lambic from Lindemans and Girardin. Tasted as a vintage bottle (obviously) at 2 years of age . Stable, off-white head, bright golden blonde colour. The complex smell of all good things in oude geuze: some sulphur already present, lemon zest, sour cream, hay, green apple, horseblanket, rose petals, old sherry, sweat... Fresh citrussy onset in the mouth with hints of wine vinegar and wheat, dry acidity with the soft, smooth rounded, mals effect that typifies both the Girardin and Lindemans lambics, finish lightly bitter, dry, very complex and very long, as is custom in this genre. All in all a very classy and perfectly balanced gueuze and a more than worthy gift to De Heeren.

Have had a chance to drink bottles of this from release until just recently; this review is an aggregate of all these occasions. Pours a hazy light orange color with smallish foam. In its younger days the aroma was sulfur, lemon, zesty spritz. As its aged there is lemon-lime, oaky funk, tangerine. For me the palate and flavors have always been very pleasant, even while young, with lemon zest, drying acid, moderate funk, hay, and key lime. Worth it.

At Heeren van Liedekercke, with S&G Tasting group, first day trip.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: funky, wood, barnyard, fruity.
TASTE: funky, wood, sour, barnyard, fruity.
Very very good geuze, liked it a lot!

Bottle sample from a generous BA. Pours a slightly hazy bright gold color with a large white head. The aroma and flavor have barnyard funk, bright citrus, some acidity, yeasty bread, herbs, hay, white grapes, lemon zest, grass, earth. Light bodied, with a tart, dry mouthfeel and average carbonation. I think I would love another shot at this.

0.75l capped and corked bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. A nice big POFF on the cap here. In the glass its as good as crystal clear, golden in color and it has a big frothy almost fluffy and lasting white top. Lots of cork and old sawdust in the nose. All the goes around the table got hjortesalt when nosing it, I did not. The cork is truly present here, as is plain old wet musky wood. A dry green apple acidity blended with wet cellar, rope and some surprising tomato sweetness. Smells nice enough, but strange in a way. Tastes nice enough also. Soft brett, not extreme on the sourness at all. More light tart with lots of cork and cellar. Its mildly carbonated this and it feels mild oily in the mouth. Ends with traces of cognac and more wood. I have to say that I had hoped for a bit more actually, but its a fine one never the less. 15.01.2014
Halmgul. Svagt disig. Härlig funk. Svag ättika. En riktigt fin geuze, men tappade tålamodet på grund av långsam servering. Svag äppelkompott i positiv bemärkelse.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 Shared at first New England ratebeer gathering, great flavors and tartness, very complex, Im a big fan. barnyard, basement aromas, very carbonated, lots of citrus flavors, very light funk lingers on.
Dark orange colour. Very well balanced geuze. Sour aroma of citrus and green apples. Easy drinkable. Very good!

Bottle sample at a sour tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks DSG. Pours yellow shiny with a huge head, aroma of fruits, light, floral, vanilla, olives, flavor of lactic acid, green tea, wood, aggressive carbonation, medium bodied, great
Bottle @ Too many geuzes only one toilet, Ulfborg 2012. Clear golden of color with a foamy white head. An aroma of salt, citrus, bitter and dusty. A flavor of horsebag, sour and dry.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 15.01.2014, 0,75l bottle sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Big fizzy mediumlasting head. Aroma is instantly masses of CO2 (or rather bakers ammonia (in Norwegian hjortetakksalt, where Google Translate suggested Deer Thank Salt, LOL!)) stinging in the nose, citrus peel, old cellar, old rope, mild vinegar, sorrel, grass, citrus. Taste is slightly harsh grassy, citrus, citrus peel, old rope, sorrel, cellar, oak. Longlasting mild bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice enough.
Smell of must, cheese anf lemon peel. Flavor was sour, slightly youn, but can tell it has huge potential for aging. Really well balanced geuze, need some for cellar
Bottle shared by cparles at Nook Tasting. Pours gold with white head. Nose and taste of horseblanket, funky musk, light cheese, lemon and wild yeast. Lighter medium body. Lively carbonation.
Slightly cloudy and golden colored. Aroma is intense, dried hay, cork, barnyard and vinegar. Taste is abit corky with hay and barnyard. Cellary notes and dry.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden body with a foamy white head. The aroma is a strong whiff of bakers ammonia, then notes of cider, cellar mold, cork, wood, old rope and dust, with hints of lemon acid and hay in the back. Taste is cellar mold, citric peel, hay, wood and hints of bitter herbs. Light body, high carbonation. For being a one-off anniversary geuze, Id expected better. Not bad, but not very good either.
Bottle. Golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is yeast, malt, brett, lemon. Flavour is sourness, yeast, malt, brett, lemon. Nice beer.
750ml bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with an averaged sized head. Barnyard, funky, citrus, and some woodiness.

Bottle shared at a sour tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Pallieter85 for this bottle! Hazy deep golden with a big bubbly white head. Lemony and oaky aroma with some cobwebs and floral hints. Sour flavor, lemony and oaky, with a bitterish and more lemony finish. Medium-bodied, strong carbonation. Good stuff.

Appearance: Cloudy golden color with no head at all to talk about.Aroma: Sour and funky.Palate: Medium + body. Moderate sour/acidic and a balanced bitterness. Heavy carbonation. That cork almost killed me.Taste: Mild sour and balanced acidic. Fruity and a very dry texture.Overall impression: Tasty and nice.Personal stats: Bottle @ Geokkjer

pours unclear bright golden with a tall frothy white head, excellent retention and lacing. barn and funk, lime, some lemons, white grapes, apricots, oak, leathery bretts, grass. bright carbonation, light body, bone-dry herbal-grassy lightly acidic and astringent finish. superb mouthfeel. excellent gueuze!

Bottle 750ml.
Pours golden with low white head. Light lacing. Aroma is of barnyard, citrus, funk. Taste is of barnyard, funk, citrus, fruits. Palate: Nice carbonation. Light body. Overall: Very good. There is some finesse here. Pretty drinkable. Outstanding.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by Julien and Pier-Luc, thanks! Clear bright golden with a medium white head and good lacing. Aroma is fruity with funk, light barnyard and peppery notes. Taste is moderately sour with nice fruit presence, leather, light funk and barnyard, spices and mineral notes. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Dry. Complex. Not too aggressive. Really fruity forward. Very good!

Bottle. Clear gold pour, lacy white head. Aroma is peppery, funky, vegetal (green pepper) notes. Taste is sour, funky lambic flavors, light citric notes, dry finish. Prockly carbonation, light body. Super easy drinking, excellent.

Bottle, 75cl with wine cork and crown cap. Wow, the cork almost made a hole in the concrete ceiling. It pours a collapsing off-white head over an unclear, carbonated orange-golden body. Lovely guezue-ish aroma with lemon and some barnyard. Some apricot hints. A tad too carbonated, dry and medium bodied. Lots of flavor, barnyard, lemon and tropical fruits, with even more fruityness. Lasting finish. Most definitely a nice one, easy drinkable and moreish. 131026

Bottle 750ml @ Geokkjer
Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, funk, barnyard and sour. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a long funky and sour finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, funk, some cheese, grains and lemon. Flavor is sweet and sour with some cellar notes, funk and cheese notes.Medium body, average carbonation.
this is a ok geuze but the overripe apples mixed with the barnyard in this one does not hit the mark for me. strange geuze.
From bottle share at Voodoo. Sour woody funky lambic. Great for a warmer day. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a slight head. Tart but dry finish.
Bottle sampled at RBSG. From notes. Sour woody fruit with citrus and grapefruit. Good sipping lambic for a hot day.
750 bottle-thanks t0rin0 @RBSG-Minni-white ring-hazy yellow. A-sour/funky, citric-lemon, musty. T-follows.
pours blonde, small white head . taste is sour, apples, bit dry. meh, glad i dint pay for it , as i dont wanna sponser these guys in any way annymore ..
Pours a cloudy orange color with white head. Aromas of citrus and earthy funk. Flavors of tart citrus and some earthy sour funk.
Bottle at RBSG. Pour is hazy orange with white head, lots of lemon, herbal grass, some funk. Lemon, biscuits, the usual suspects.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 Bomber at RBSG. Slightly hazy orange pour with a foamy white head. Fruity. Slightly tart. Yeasty. Killer.

Thanks to bu11zeye for this bottle. Pours hazy orange with a foamy/creamy white head. Aroma is earthy/funky gueuze. ;Near full bodied due to carb. Flavor is sour/tart/earthy/lightly fruity. Very smooth. Finishes brilliant. Most excellent.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours orange copper with an attractive beige head and a musty sour fruit aroma. There is a hearty caramel malt flavor with lots of carbonation and sour fruit. This is a lovely gueuze that I would love to sip all afternoon.

Bottle at Sweet&Sour in Sätila 20130810. Clear golden beer with a rich lively white head. Sour rubber aroma, leather, citrus, grapes, grapefruit, earthy, hay, tart, floral, some woody notes. Rubber flavor, tart, funky, hay, grapefruit, leather, barnyard, horseblanket, earthy, woody, dandelions, mango, citrus. Sourish earthy finish, tart, grapefruit, hay, some dandelions.
Bottle. Clear golden with a huge creamy offwhite head. Citrus, sourish, rubber aroma. Sourish, citrus, woody and earthy flavour.

750 ml bottle bought @ Etre Gourmet. Pours hazy deep golden with a huge creamy, frothy and fizzy offwhite head that quickly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is sour and funky with crackers, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, moist wood, horse-blanket, rubber, white grapes, leather, barnyard and hints of gastric acid. Taste is sour and tart with crackers, rubber, hay, moist wood, horse-blanket, grapefruit juice, gooseberries, unripe kiwi, white grape skins, grapefruit juice, lemon juice, grapefruit rinds, minerals, moist soil and barnyard. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, tiny round, tiny watery and medium bodied. Finish is sour and tart with crackers, grapefruit rinds, rubber, leather, horseblanket, barnyard, hay, dry soil, lemon juice, moist soil and hints of gastric acid. Solid tasty gueuze...
Bomber tnx to Alex. Pours cloudy pale amber golden with a nice off white head. Aroma is inte sely stable cellar wet blanket dry moldy fruity. Flavor is nicely bitter dry cellary astringent bretty.

Bottle at DHVL. Almost clear deep golden liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma of funk, barnyard, light mineral, apples, light lemon and lemon peel. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of minerals, apples and funk. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice.
Bottle @ ZZT VII, thx to everyone for sharing their bottles. Typical aroma of horseblanket and barnyard. Medium sour taste. Medium in complexity, nicely balanced.
Tasted at ZZT 7.  Pours clear golden with an off white head.  Aroma of barnyard funk, horse blanket, tart fruit.  Flavor is light sweet, fairly heavy acidic.  Medium bodied with light carbonation.
@ZZT VII, oranje/geel van kleur en helder, witte schuimkraag, ruikt als een geuze, zuur, muf, appels, smaakt lekker alleen teveel koolzuur wat de smaak overheerst
Bottle @ ZZT7 thx to caesar. Hazy orange with no head. Smells sour, rubber, burning plastic. Tastes quite sour, fruity. Way too much carbo, medium body.

750mL brought back from the restaurant. Split with my wife. 

A: Opening bottle of this damn near killed me, so look out. Pours with a massive foamy head that settles into something more appropriate. Color is cloudy straw-orange.

N: Oak, light sourness, ginger, and lemon zest. Lots of wood in this. Measurable level of funk and plenty of leather. Some bleu cheese and sulphuric acid. Perhaps not as complex as the big boys, but the flavors are assertive. 

T: More of the denseness from the oak, and its plenty sour with a slight malt sweetness to round out the edges. Has some sharp acid which comes and goes and detracts from the experience when its there. Appropriate level of doughiness. 

M: Very dry and clean. Light bodied and well carbonated.

O: Tasty stuff, and a lot better than I expected it to be. (Maybe the year and a half has knocked out some of the kinks.) A worthy beer.

750mL bottle at DHVL, pours a clear golden orange with a medium white foamy head. Aroma of moderate funky notes, a little hay, and very little acidity. Flavour brings out traditional barnyard funk, a la a 3 Fonteinen gueuze, with a little leather, and a subtle acidity. Really funky and low on the sourness. Delicious stuff - a very high quality, excellent gueuze.

Bottle a while back while on vacation. Pours a hazy orange with rather large white head. Some particles. Aroma is hay funk, some musty horse blanket to almost leather like. Taste is rather sour with a stone fruit like taste near the finish. Not as dry as I would have liked.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
Bottle. [thanks Geus]
Pours clear orangey copper golden with a large, frothy, white head that soon dissipates. Aroma has lovely tart notes, green apple peel, unripe pear, citrus, light lactic. Very soft apple vinegar. High carbonation, fine dry and light creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has lovely zinging tartness, citrus, light vinegar. Dusty dry oaky in the finish. Lovely gueuze.

Bottle split with Leighton and Bruce at DHVL, 22/03/13.
Lightly hazed golden with a thin off white head that maintains its presence.
Nose is sour lemon, wood, grape skins, musty, grandads shed.
Taste comprises lemon rinds, light sugar, tarte fruits, dank wood, musty grapes.
Medium bodied, dry and dry, tarte and sour finish, dry!
Good tackle!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 750 ml bottle - pours intense golden to orange with a creamy wealthy clouded head. Very citrussy nose with floral notes, the typical funk is only present in a very subtle way. Mouthfeel: one of the creamiest geuzes I have ever tasted. A rich and voluptuous geuze with nice sour and bitter balance. Taste is then very funky and dusty. Short and dry finish, and then bitterness is kicking in... Nice!! Lindemans lambic character is very present.

Bottle many thanks to Pallieter85. Golden colored beer with huge white head. Aroma of oak, funk, vinous notes, barnyard. Tart taste together with grapefruit zest, lemon, oak, earthy notes. tart finish. Nice, complex Gueuze .

Tasted at RBBWG 2013. Pours light & bright yellow/orange with an off-white head. Smell is tart fruit, citrus, must, light malt. Taste is slightly sour, tart fruit, citrus, funk, wood. A dry end and I get a touch of artificial sweetness flavor too. Active carbonation with light body.

Clear golden colour, white head. Tart aroma, citrus, funk, silage, orange zest, quite floral. Sour citric flavour, citrus, tart, fruits, lots of citrus peel. Sour finish, tart, citrus and marmalade.
Love this stuff!
(From 75cL bottle @ RBBWG II, Wilrijk 2013. Courtesy of 77ships. Thank you, sir!)

750 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBWG 2013. Darker shade of lambic orange with a solid white head. Smell is horseblanket, citrus, oranges, zesty, rich, fluffy, delicious horseblanket Taste is huger floral & horseblanket, peaches, citrus, oranges, sharp, clear funk, fruity, sharp, fluffy so damn good final definitive proof that Lindemans can be as good as I thought that they could be awesome stuff. People would good go crazy if this was made by 3F.
Sampled from bottle @ RBBWG 2013. Totally hazy opaque yellow-orange color with no head at all. Aroma and taste of sourness and tart with some kind of fruityness.

750 ml bottle shared by Kan. Thanks, dude. Pours a richer hazy golden yellow pour. A touch of darkness, frothy offwhite head laces as a firm layer, good lacing. Aromas are rich and vibrant, good lemon and tart fruit, some citrus, tropical fruit and sour apple. Gentle hay, gentle funk and cobwebs. Mellow oak, lactic acid, with barnyard, horseblanket. Firm sourness tart vibrancy on the nose. Initial is mellow body, lighter end with some firm sour tart elements up front. Lemon, sour fruit of apple, pear, and gentle tropical elements. Sour front end trails off with mellow dough, fruit, and straw. Touches of dryness, funk, and grass. Earth and dryness into the backend, some yogurt and lactic elements take hold. Not as sour, a bit of sweet fruit element sweeps me up as opposed to being sharp or firmly sour. Funky and lactic,s weet fruit elements, some straw and dryness, gentle barrel. Soft and mellow, it feels young. But is it? I dont think so. A solid lambic. Nose speaks to me and the front end.. Falls off into the back and finish.

Bottle at De Heeren. October 2012.

The beer is clear and light orange colored with a formidable, cloudy, white head. The aroma brings some cheesy funk, hay, authentic Belgian lambic scents. Nice flavor! Ahh...cheesy, barnyard funk with hints of citrus. Transporting aroma and taste. Really wonderful. Low carbonation and silky smooth on the palate. A terrific example of the style, I feel fortunate to have tried this. What a great place to enjoy food and beer.

2000th rating. Bottle thanks to Rick. Pours a cloudy orange with a small frothy white head leaving spotty lacing along the glass. The aroma is a strong funk and tart. Medium mouthfeel with a sour fruit and strong tart finish. Wow, really enjoyed this gueuze from Lindemans.

Bottle at Theis and Mettes sour+ tasting. Pours a hazy golden with a small white head and lacings. Sour with some sweetness. Fresh sour aromas of vinegar and cask wood and sour berries. <medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Nice and fresh .

damn rick!?! thanks for pulling this bottel out!! .. . pours a lively hazed gold amber .. medium head, lacing is quite good too .. . tart hay, lemon zest, very light horse blanket, and johnson and johnson .. . 
.. . group H .. . very impressive lambic, quite balanced- easy to drink while carrying a bold gentleman quality .. . . haha, city get real madrid, lil mike hunts!!

Bottle @ DHVL. Pours deep hazy gold with a big white head. The nose is mellow white grape skin, dried wood, sugared gymsock. The taste is mildly soapy lemon rind, more grapes, angel food cake with a light chalky finish. Mineral-heavy mouthfeel. Light. Tasty for sure, but a bit muddled. Overall, a good geuze, but not elite. It certainly felt like a step down following a 3F OG Vintage...
750 bottle. Pours slightly hazy with a white head.  Nice tart, citrus, tangy nose. Taste is amazingly smooth, nice tartness that doesnt burn the tongue. Balanced and very drinkable. Sweet.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Bottle on the RBSG 12 bus. Orange-blonde, very nice, funky nose, clean, dry, citrus and leather. Sourness is good but not huge. Well balanced with a nice dry finish.

75o ml corked and capped bottle shared by BeerandBlues2 (thanks Brad!) poured a hazy gold with a small lasting ivory head. Aromas of straw, apple, citrus, earthiness and barnyard funk. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of apple, straw, citrus and light barnyard funk with a crisp dry tart lingering funky finish.

750 ml bottle thanks to Ayrton in Belgium. Pours a deep copper color with a medium white head. An awesome nose of pure Gueuze; wood, lemons, sweeter tropical fruit, dusty oak. The flavor is great: robust sharp hints of very sour notes, more woody dryness, lemon zing, light acidic notes but more apricot and very smooth grains. The wheat is noticeable. This is an excellent brew, very big flavors but very mellow. A near perfect blend. Damn good.

Bottle shared on the RBSG bus.  Pours a light orange pour and a fluffy white head.  Dusty, yeasty, funky and lightly sour in the nose.  Flavor is straight forward.  Some sourness, dry yeasty funk.  Pretty good overall but not the most amazing Gueuze.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, thanks to Aaron for the pour! Pour is hazy golden orange with white head, aroma has notes of lemon, biscuit, some nice grass, earth, some dusty horseblanket as well, hints of basement and funk.  Taste is a nice mix of lemon, biscuit, some dust and basement, hints of earth, slight bread, toffee notes, vanilla, finishing fairly sweet and dry, slightly acidic.

Bottle at home shared with friends courtesy of Aaron. Thanks again for this one! Poured a slightly hazy apricot color in appearance with a medium white head that wants to stick around. Aroma is oak, tart apricots, lemon peel, dusty basement, horse blanket, and funk. Taste is much the same, funk, brett, wood, light grass, dust, a touch of vinegar, and citric acid. Mouthfeel is medium with medium carbonation.

750ml bottle shared by Doug, thanks man 
Appearance: Cloudy golden with a medium sized white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Sour, tart dry fruit, barnyard and spices 
Taste: Sour fruit, vinegar with a dry finish
A great Gueze.
Poured from a 750 ml bottle, thanks to Doug. This is a fantastic geuze. A nice balance between the wild funk of the yeast and the malts. Super tasty.
Bottle shared on the RBSG 2012 bus. Tart aroma, dusty lemony sour. Mainly a citric sour with a restrained dry funkiness. Nice long dry finish, sorta plain overall.

75cl bottle. It pours a hazy golden / orange colour with a big white head. Foam vanishes quickly. Aroma is sour and refreshing, citrusy and funky, some dust and some urine. Nice but not the most complex. Taste is slightly sweet, medium acidic with a mostly tart and dry finish. Notes of lemon zast and citrus are dominant, with loads of funk, and some dust. Body is quite light with lively carboantion. Overall, very nice geuze, maybe a bit thin in body and not as complex as other examples of the style.

Bouteille de 750 ml, merci beaucoup à Dany et Marie-France. Arômes de brettanomyces rappelant le foin et le citron. Robe blonde, plutôt limpide, belle effervescence et mousse tenant bien. En bouche, les brettanomyces sont à lavant-plan, contribuant principalement des notes rustiques de foin. Belle présence citronnée et de céréales. Somme toute peu boisée. Finale moyennement acide pour le style. Une très belle gueuze, possédant un lien familial avec la Cuvée René, tout en montrant son propre caractère.

750 mL bottle @ De Heeren van Liedekercke. Pours a hazy golden appearance with a nice white head. Somewhat funky/cheesy, quite floral, lemon tart, light vanilla aroma. The Girardin seems to really provide a nice puckering, fairly funky flavor along with a very nice, refreshing lemon tartness, some cheesy, well carbonated flavor with a fairly dry finish. Exceeded my expectations. Very nice.

(750ml bottle)  Pours a cloudy orange body with a tall off-white head.  Aroma of grapefruit, horse blanket, minerals, lemon peel, oak, cork, barnyard, mustiness, and mold.  Flavor of grapefruit, orange, lemon, tangerine, apricot, and minerals with a dry finish.

Split this bottle at a sour tasting. Poured a clear-orange color with a thin white head. Aroma was some spice, tart, with some funk character alongside the barnyard. Touch of spice and tart funk notes in the flavor. This was okay, but a bit so so (then again, I dont really know my Gueuze all that well so this could be a superb representation).

Pour is a hazy light yellow with a slightly off white bubbly head.  The nose has a ton of cheesy funk, light leathery brett with a nice sweet appricot to balance.  Taste is solid, funk is dialed down a bit, less cheesy rind and more leathery, dusty notes.  Sweetness is decent, not super bright but nice lemon, appricot and peach.  Fairly sour, dry finish on a light body, assertive carbonation.

My first bottle at de Heeren van Liedekercke & entered as my 100th rating of the month! 

Pours a golden color with a small tight white head that leaves a nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is barnyardy right up front with some light lemony and citrus rind aroma. Its really quite inviting but a little one note, I feel bad saying that though, because it sounds like a bad thing, this smells very good. 

The flavor is dry and has a nice white grape character to it, almost champagne like with a moderate level of sourness and a very well defined clean lemony character. 

Wonderful.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden orange color with a white head. Has a fruity sour funky barnyard aroma. Fruity sour tart funky citrus flavor. Has a fruity tart sour funky citrus finish with barnyard hints.
Corked bottle. Orange blonde color. Oak, lemon and peach in the almost vinous aroma. Sour oaky flavor with lemon, grapefruit and hints of pineapple. Good complexity. Lovely gueuze.

Thanks to Blake for sharing!  Poured clear, honeyed golden with a tall, fizzy white head.  The aroma picked up zesty lemon, foot funk, and light leather over a soft pale malty base.. vinegary on the back of the nose.  The flavor found tart lemon, vinegar, and fairly fresh oak on the tip of the tongue.. funky, but a tad restrained.. more vinegar, funk, and some floral notes on the long, refreshing finish.  Tangy on the palate with high carbonation.. felt good, but a little too clean.

Bottle.

Hazy dark golden with a small white head. This was a soft and sympathetic Gueuze. Not extremely tart but nicely drinkable. Wood, apples, funk, lemon and yeast.

Trevlig syrlig doft. Tydlig fat och äpple. Smaken är lite mer beskeden. Lätt, fruktig utan större syrlighet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75cl Bottle at AHBS. Hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma is sour, lemon, funky, light sweet floral. Flavour is sour, lemons, acid, funk, light dung, lemon sour finish. Light bodied. Quite nice actually, but also a bit too sour for my taste.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2012 2006 Bottle to oversized snifter (thanks to hop20).  Looks great and smells solid too.  Funky  deliciousness!

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2013 Pours golden orange with an offwhite head. The aroma is sweet and zesty from the yeast.  The flavor is sweet, zesty, and light but pleasantly tart on the tongue. The second time around I got delicious green apple on both the aroma and flavor. It developed really well.

24/III/2012 - 75cl bottle @ VBPF 12 (Jette) - BB: n/a (2012-281) Clear orange beer, big yellowish head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: tobacco, citrus, peppery, lemon juice, touch of liquor. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: lemony, mandarin, peppery, typical geuze barnyard. Aftertaste: fruity, mandarines, little bitter, some slightly sweet touch.

Bottle @ VBPF12.
Dorée paille, col épais blanc cassé.
Arôme est typique de gueuze, renfermé, aigre, citronné avec un léger fruité.
En bouche, étable, renfermé, aigre, citronné, râpant sur la langue, fruité amer, houblon fleuri sec, note dépice, froment. Le tout garde ce profile boisé/épicé sur un long fini sec/aigre avec ce long fini presque de sciure aigre qui reste sur la langue.
Comme souvent avec une gueuze, assez dur à décrire, ça reste dans la lignée sans pour cela être mémorable.

Bottle, 03/16/2012.  Opens a gusher with huge foamy head, clear golden orange pour.  Head dies down to almost nothing after a minute or so.  Nose is fruity, apricots and apples prevalent, with musty, earthy tartness evident with barnyard aromas.  Taste is tart citrus and apples, acidity low for geuze, peppery earthy funk, oak finish.  High carbonation and dry finish, lacking a strong aftertaste, but balanced and drinks easy.   Well done, but perhaps a little too clean at this point- look forward to seeing how it develops.

Bottle 750ml.Clear medium orange yellow colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, moderate barnyard, leather, citrus, fruity. Flavour is moderate sweet and light light acidic with a average to long duration, soft and easy. Very balance and a bit young - but i thnik maybe to soft and easy ... a beginer gueuze ;O) Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. [20120127]

Pours a shimmering peach/gold with a massive white head.    Nose is soft stone fruits, sulfur, egg, sour citrus, old creaky wood.  Super dry and sulfuric in the mouth.  Approaches wet pavement but doesnt really get there as the sulfur is really pungent.  It does have a very nice feel though, high carbonation and good dry champagne consistency.  May actually be very good in a couple years.

Poured into a tulip.

3.0 A: Lightly hazed golden wheat color. First pour gave a big head. Second pour yielded three fingers of foamy white head that fell quickly, but stuck around near the end. A bit of lacing.

3.5 S: Apple and peachy fruitiness. Musty basement, rotting log, and musky animal funkiness. Super dry. Bleu cheese and dry-rot sweatsocks. Lots of funk in this. Low on acidity.

3.5 T: Again super funky. Apple and especially apple orchard earthiness. Rotting log, dry-rot, musty basement, stale bread, and sweat. Not as cheesy as the nose. Again, acidity is quite low with minor lactic acid and basically no acetic. Oak with a moderate tannin component.

3.5 M: Lighter body. Good gueuze-level carbonation. Lacking creaminess though.

3.5 D: Decent beer, but certainly not worth the price. Im glad I didnt get an extra to age. I will say that this is a funk lovers dream. Theres tons of it. For me, I would have preferred a bit more acidity and a bit more sweetness. This is dry even for a gueuze.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-03-2012 02:07:48
Bottle at Papsø - Thanks. Cloudy yellow/golden - light offwhite head. Cheese, wooden, horsey, nice barnyard, light sulfor, ok acid, dryness, light harsh sharpness. Lovely.

75cl, at 5%Vol, as DHL 20 Anniversary Blend, new exclusive brew Anno 2011, from De Heeren van Liedekercke Denderleeuw, complex sour brew, sour/malty and slightly woody/fruity, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew, yet expensive!

Bottle at Trapisseds house courtesy of same, cheers Alan!
Light amber with fine stream of bubbles and fine white head. Fairly lactic nose with some sweet lemon undertones. Well carbonated with plenty of citrus and acidic flavours and a touch of goatiness in the finish.

Bottle shipped from Belgium.  The beer pours to a glowing light amber body with a ton of champagne carbonation.  A long lasting head sits on top.  The aroma is lightly funky sour lemons with tangy horse blankets.  Fairly clean and super easy to drink.  The flavor is lemons and clean malts.  Nicely blended for that easy to drink gueuze.  Lightly acidic.  Very clean tastes.

Bottle at Papsø.
Hazy golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Light acidic aroma of berries, oak and barnyard.
Light acidic flavour of barnyard and berries with notes of oak.
Tart finish.

Bottle, 5%. Mouthwatering acetic aroma, nicely earthy with a hint of vinegar sourness. Cloudy dark golden colour. The flavour is nicely acetic with some grape peel tannin. Thin mouthfeel. Subdued citric finish, not so powerful afterall.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2012 Bottle. Cloudy pale beer with a frothy, quickly diminishing white aroma. Bretty nose. Taste is tart, citrussy, ripe apples, well worn socks, straw, light sweet malts, wood, leading to a dry and tart finish.

cloudy yellow, small white head.
aroma is tart, sour, slightly woody.
flavor is sour, earthy, quite dry sour.
nice dry sour gueze.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a cloudy golden with a very lively, bubbly off-white head dissipating in no time. Lovely Bretty nose, lots of fart and barnyard. Light in body, high in carbonation, some initial sweet fruitiness quickly relieved by tart Brett and sulphur with a fusty edge. Dry and tart finish. A very traditional Gueuze. 140212

Bottled. A hazy dark golden beer with thin off-white head. The aroma has notes of brettanomyces, wood, malt, and lemons. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, brettanomyces, wood, and malt, leading to a very tart finish. Thank yespr for sharing.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2016 Bottle @ Too many Geuzes - only one toilet , Ulfborg 2012 - Day 1. Golden with nice, foamy, lasting white head. Malty aroma with grassy, fruity and bretty notes. Flavor is mild sour and funk, barnyard, very malty and some fruity notes. Very drinkable.

bottle.  so one glass came across as very metallic and paint-like, with strong rubber / glue / cork notes.  the other had none of this, instead was wholly bright with fruity and tangy esters and acids. zesty citrus rind and dusty basement must give it a vibrant but rustic character.  more fruity than horsey, with medium acidity with touches of honey malt and wheat, its fun and delicious but doesnt rank among the more complex geuze to come out of Belgium.

10th February 2012Shared with the Kernel crew. Bottle says 5.0%! Very hazy gold beer. Little white head. Softish airy palate, semi dry. Pleasant generic fruits with mild and balanced sourness. Crisp finish. A nice gentle sour this one, could actually imagine sessioning  it.

Thanks to stakem for sharing this one with us at our recent gueuze tasting.

A - Pours clear golden orange with a frothy one and a half finger tall white head leaving light streaks of lace down the glass.

S - This one is funky through and through. Once the funk dies down a bit you can detect some fresh cut grass, oak, funky cheese, some fresh cut citric fruit and a dash of sulfur.

T - Starts off with a bit of sour lemon zest quickly giving way to hints of the typical barn yard funk, blue cheese, oak and some dry maltiness. The sometimes prickly carbonation really doesnt help this one. Finish is pretty dry, lingering for quite awhile after consumption.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Not as tart as I was expecting with a dry finish. A touch too much carbonation as well.

O - This one was pretty good. It really didnt have any glaring flaws but when we where drinking some of the best gueuzes on the pallet it really didnt shine either.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear golden with a big and lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and bretty. Flavor is quite sweet, moderate sour and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 270112

Bottle @ Too many geuzes only one toilet, Ulfborg 2012. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Vahue manuer, grain and barnyard. Very young without any really complexity Tasty but I somehow dont see the ageing potentia as in for instance the young Horals.

Bottle thanks to GRG1313. Pours with a clear golden hued body and a massive white head. Aromas show a bit of sulfur at first. Floral, funky, peppery, sour, carbonic acid. Bretty. Flavors show a massive carbonic bite at first. Estery, floral and a deep funk. Horseblanket. Acidity is a bit on the mild side. Very high carbonation (over carbonated for my palate), and dry.

Bottle @ FOneFan. Hazy golden with medium foamy off-white head. Aroma is malt, tart, fruit and a little barnyard. Flavour is malt, little tart, medium sweet, little citrus, little citric and medium dry.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Huge head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, malt, grass, stable and leather. Not that sour. Quite mild and easy drinkable.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2012 bottle.   aroma of bright citrusy lemonzest, pleasant old world grass and earth.   awesome leather, rustic, sweaty funk.   bright sweaty cheesy funk.   tasty.  like quite a bit.   clean.  dry.    awesome.    LIKE A lot

Sampled at STLWills 30th b-day tasting.  I may have rated this one higher if I had it on its own instead of being in the middle of so many excellent other beers.  Pours clear amber/orange with an off-white head.  The aroma is citrusy, clean and a bit maltiness than most lambics with some pale and caramel malt on the nose.  Medium / light crisp body with mild semi-sharp carbonation.  The taste is very tart and sour with apricot and some vinegar and lots of fruitiness.  There are some medicinal traits and aspirin along with an alcohol taste that seems odd for a 6.5% beer.  This is decent, but not up to the standards of others in the tasting tonight.

750 ml bottle sampled at STLWills 30th birthday party- thanks again! Pours a clear, bright gold color with rising bubbles and a big white head. Aroma of bready funk, bright citrus, herbs, straw, white grapes, and something plastic-like. Flavor of grass, lemon, herbs, banryard funk, and earth. Light-bodied, with a tart, dry mouthfeel and medium-high carbonation. Not bad, but didnt stand up to the others opened that night.

750ml bottle pours a translucent, bright gold with a fluffy, white head.  Travlr smelled it and said, "smells like belly button lint."  Very funky aromas, feet, a little grass, some tartness, weeds.  Flavor is lightly sweet, lemon, a little candy, grass, hay, some perfume.  Medium bodied, soft, tart finish.  Flavor was a bit of a let down.

Thanks Travlr! Hazy straw pour with a small white head. Huge must, lemony nectar, leather, and basement. The flavor holds even more lemon than the aroma would suggest, giving way to notes of must and cheesecloth. Bright acidity with good balance. Perfect pillowy effervescence finishing super dry.

Bottle shared by Travlr.  Pours light gold with a huge, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is earthy, barn, straw and meal malt, grapes, cassis, cellar, and old hops.  Flavor is earthy, farmhouse, straw and meal malt, lactic sourness, grapes, cassis, old hops, low bitterness and a dry finish.  Light body, no warmth, medium-high carbonation.

transparent gold, thin soft white ring. moderately eggy, lightly salty, moderate plant stalk, lightly lactic. Flavor is salty, high carbonation mutes, light lactic, rindy finish, little wheat, more fruit and sparkling acid, heavy salt and goat acrid in finish. Very similar to memory of unlabeled bottle joost let us try about six months ago, so while good, not holding a huge amount of age promise.

Thanks to travlr for this awesome bottle! Hazy peach colored pour with a big fizzy head. Nose holds lemon, cheesecloth, musty hay, and barnyard. A really nice combination of vibrant and dank funk. Lots of big lemon and cheese on the flavor as well, with the basement/cobweb notes taking a back seat. Lovely stuff.

750mL thanks to Travlr. The pour is a hazy peach with riveting carbonation producing a thick, white head. Nose is a little one dimensional- subtle sulfur but big lemon peel and grass. Subtle must and cheesy funk. Taste is sharp sour, lemon citric, lighter feeling with powerful grapefruit presence. Effervescent palate. Decent geuze for now that needs a lot more age before the Girardin complexity kicks in.
Salty and citrus nose with light sulfur. Lightly sweet and moderately tart. The sweetness is mostly sugary and juicy, but with little depth. Kind of falls apart. Flavor is lightly eggy and salty.

Bottle shared by Travlr: Pours a clear bright golden with a frothy clingy lacing white head. Has a fresh tart funky nose with some hay and light cheesy notes.  Starts with good effervescence and puckering tartness with a touch of light fruits and grassy bitterness before a smooth tart finish.  Has good funky complexity throughout.
Strong funky aroma - barnyard.  Notes of pineapple and citrus peel.  Flavor is lightly sweet and moderately sour.  Mostly dry and bitter.  Strong note of funky and barnyard.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2012 750ml bottle opened 12/3/2011
A: A massive, billowy white head crowns a clear, golden-orange body marked by vibrant carbonation.  Streaks of foam left with each sip.
S: Assertive lemon, green grapes, and orange notes.  Soft musty oak and earth.  There is no doubt about Girardins influence in the blend.
T: Like the nose there is a nice bright citric and green grape component.  However, tha subtle mineral quality that great Girardin vintages have, starts to come though towards the end.  Light wet hay and musty oak rounds things out.
M: Medium carbonation, aggressive carbonation, moderate acidity and mild, crisp, sourness in the finish.
O: All said, I am really looking forward to this aging.  Its young still, and the fact that its a 1 & 2 year blend is evident in the nose.  I think time will do wonders to this beer, particularly in the nose.

Huge thanks to callmemickey for sharing this rare treat. 

Pours a cloudy golden yellow color with a two finger frothy white head that slowly settles into a lasting ring. Streaks and spots of lace left behind. 

Musty, funky aroma with a strong barnyard/horsey character giving off hints of wet hay, oak and straw. Theres also a nice lactic funk presence along with some sweet citrus acidity and faint malts. Little to no acetic character. Smells great. 

Tart, puckering mouthfeel with a good balance of lactic funk, citrus fruit, earthy oak and subtle acetic vinegar. Decently sour but pretty delicate and well balanced with the lemon acidity and musty oak complimenting the lactic funk. As the palate adjusts, the citrus and funky yeast flavors become more prominent. It could use a bit more funk/sourness but this beer is well balanced, flavorful and easy to put down.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Dark honey colored, brilliantly clear pour. Huge white head that leaves a little bit of lacing as it quickly subsides. Big cork, funky barnyard, aroma. Wood, pepper, malt and funk. Dry woody, funky - but not too much, flavor. Slightly sour. Thin. Very good. I could drink this one all day.

A steady, but careful pour into my large Tripel Karmeliet tulip produces a fluffy, four-finger thick, pale tan tinged, off-white colored head; the beer leaves lots of lacing on the sides of my glass.  The beer is a light amber color that shows an almost clear, pale amber tinged, gold hue when held up to the light.  When I first pull out the cork and am pouring this I get funky notes of urea, lactic acid and musk.  A more focused look at the aroma yields a big, funky mushroom note, that gets quite musty, amply sour in its lactic character, plus it has some more complex acidity to it (not just lactic, but it doesnt smell like it has any acetic, at least to me yet).  There is a substantial, muted (if that makes sense) fruitiness that smells mostly of tart grapefruit, but there are more subtle notes of pear and apple.  A really deep, lingering stay over the aroma yields notes of grassy grain, cracker like malt / wheat and some light phenolic notes.  The nose has quite a bit of musty, musky, phenolic funkiness to it that is quite nice, the acidity is a bit lighter than I would prefer, but it still has a nice sour smell to it.

The beer is quite light, definitely tart, with a prickly carbonation that washes over the palate.  The finish has a light, lactic acidity that lingers very lightly on the palate.  A funky mushroom character and woody oakiness picks up towards the beginning of each sip and lingers through to the finish before it is mostly wiped clean by an astringent, tannic character, carbonic acid and, surprisingly enough, nothing; the beer sort of disappears because it is so light in many ways.  There is a soft slickness to this beer when it is in the mouth (from the lactic acidity, and perhaps a touch from the oak), but mostly this is quite light, even for a Gueuze; it is not quite watery, but it is damn close.  The Brettanomyces funkiness isnt overly aggressive here, but does contribute a nice supporting character to this beer; the mushroom notes come from this, as does a hint of medicinal phenolics, perhaps a touch of mostly cured plastic.  As the beer warms up it picks up more grapefruit like notes towards the finish, and this gets especially amplified in my second pour that still has a zippy carbonation.

The body is perhaps the biggest flaw in this beer, most really good Gueuzes have a chewiness to them, part of it is more grain / malt character (in the flavor department to), but also part of it is more lactic slickness and more oak structure.  Still this is quite a good Gueuze, it would be perfectly balanced if it had more biting acidity and more grain character to go along with the funkiness and mustiness that is found here.  In the end, like the finish, this beer ends up disappearing and being too quickly forgotten.  A very nice beer, especially since I like Gueuze / Lambic so much, but this is actually quite a bit of a letdown b/c of the track record of the de Heeren van Liedekercke Lambics to date.  Still, I would be ecstatic to have a bunch of this beer on hand.

bottle... fantastic looking gueuze, medium golden orange thats a perfect color, faint tan head leaves about a finger cap that lasts forever, light lace, cant imagine a better looking gueuze... a bit of a sweeter nose but this smells great, light fruity oranges, a bit of lemon, funky cheese, spider webs, musky light farm yard sour throughout, complex, funk could be a touch more sour but great, cant wait to see how this ages, the more it warms the sweeter it gets, its addicting... sadly a bit disappointed with the taste, its just too weak, the front is almost devoid of flavor, all the sweet is gone, just a light straw sour finish, tastes good not great, expecting fireworks got average... get a bottle and try it in the future, Im certainly looking to have this again and re-rate a year down the line

75 cL bottle at De Heeren van Liedekercke. Pours cloudy yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is light mouldy and barnyard. Crisp citrusy and mild fruity. vague cornish flavoured, light earthy touch. I get more Girardin from the blend than Lindeman. Dry, brett and citric finish. Solid carbonation, yet small bubbles. A bit rough yet nice.

Bottle at Craft Beer Co tasting, thanks to Matt. It pours golden yellow, with a massive bubbly white head. The nose is cheese, farmyard, sulphur, sweaty feet and medicinal. The taste is farmyard, big lemon citrus, Granny Smith apple, lime, gooseberry, pith, wheat and hay, with a dry-tart finish. Medium body, fine fizzy carbonation, foamy mouth-feel and moderate sourness. A tasty gueuze, but could be done with some aging.

Bottle at 1st CBC Sunday Tasting. Many thanks to Matt for this one. Pours clear gold with a medium, white foam head. Grass, sweat and must aroma. Light to medium sweet, dry grass, subtle lemon. Medium bodied with explosive carbonation. Semi-dry finish, slight apples, grass, lemon, very slight socks. Pretty beautiful beer.

A: The beer pours a cloudy orange color with a very tall, rocky, white head.

S: As I had hoped, a very funky nose to this.  There is a fair amount of sulfur up front, but it does dissipate.  Lots of musty oak with a mild fruit aroma, mostly lemon zest with a bit of apple.

T: Lemon zest flavors are more prominent on the flavor.  There is only a mild to moderate tartness to this, but it the flavor is also quite funky.  Plenty of yeast and barnyard and a bit of grass.

M: Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation.

O: Had a bit of a Girardin Black Label mixed with Cuvee Rene feel to it.  I liked it, though I would like to see if that initial sulfur aroma dissipates over time.

Blended by Lindemands from 1-year and 2-year-old Lindemans lambic and 2-year-old Girardin lambic.

Several pours from the bottle at De Heerens 20th Anniversary celebration on Saturday September 3, a few hours after arriving in Belgium. Served in a HORAL mini gueuze tumbler.

Pours a nice clear golden color with a slight orange tint. Big, foamy white head and loads of lacing on the way down. Very bubbly.

Nose brings forward a really nice amount of funk and light cheese. Faint citrus and a nice earthy complexity. Horse blanket throughout. Some lemon and then a bit more funk. Very earthy. Quite cheesy as well.

The flavor is close to the nose, but not quite as complex. Probably closer to a 4.25. Plenty of funk and cheese plus a bit of citrus and a mild lactic acidity. Lemon is there as well as a bit of barnyard funk. Faint straw.

Light body and very crisp carbonation. Light acidity throughout with a good dosing of lemon rind behind the funk. Very dry finish. Quite tasty and a nice addition to the De Heeren lineup.
A nice and simple easy drinking geuze. More Lindemans than Girardin but just a little more complex. Not overly sour and lacking a bit of funk but is still very young and should mature very nicely.

75cl bottle at DHVL. This is made by Lindemans which is not a bad thing if they are creating an original style lambic which this one is. There is 2 year old Girardin in this blend but at this young stage im detecting much more Lindemans Cuvee Rene than Girardin Black Label. Although similar to the Cuvee Rene it has an extra depth and edge probably created by the addition of the Girardin lambic. The beer is too young to rate properly right now...Will pull one out of the cellar in a few months and re-rate.

Bottle generously shared by Joost, thank you sir.  Hazy goldenrod color, large fluffy. airy head.  Aroma is subtle smoke, white pepper, and attic.  Taste is dusty lemons with just a subtle edge of funk.  Very dry and peppery finish.  Still young, but has amazing potential.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2011 Huge, remarkably stable, fine just off-white head over very Champenoise orange-golden beer; yeast loosening gradually from the bottle upon pouring.  Putteke , sulphury, old wet wood, old fruit, citrus and horseblanket. Citrus, citruszeste, liqueur without sweetness, lactic acid, fruity acids; very well-balanced, woody wryness; hints at sweetness in the very finish. Extra-dry, dry-out effect, very effervescent carbonation. Excellent gueuze, with just enough blending for lending it a strong, young character.  Mals , no harshness whatsoever, excellent balance, worthy of the celebration.  Thanks to Raf!!
